meanings.definition: Hit or strike with a heavy blow.
meanings.sent1: He slugged the ball with all his might.
meanings.sent2: She slugged the punching bag to release her anger.
meanings.sent3: The superhero slugged the villain, sending him flying through the air.
meanings.sent4: The storm slugged the coast, causing massive destruction.
meanings.sent5: The boxer slugged his opponent, knocking him out cold.

meanings.definition: Drink quickly or in large quantities.
meanings.sent1: After the game, he slugged down a whole bottle of water.
meanings.sent2: She slugged her coffee before rushing to work.
meanings.sent3: He slugged the soda like it was the last drink on earth.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runner slugged the energy drink to keep going.
meanings.sent5: She slugged the smoothie, feeling refreshed instantly.

meanings.definition: A metal disk used as a coin or token.
meanings.sent1: He found a shiny slug in the sand at the beach.
meanings.sent2: She dropped the slug into the arcade machine to play a game.
meanings.sent3: The kids collected slugs to trade for candies at school.
meanings.sent4: The old slot machine only accepted slugs as tokens.
meanings.sent5: The lucky slug brought him good fortune at the casino.
